intro: Echium michaelis, commonly known as the Michael's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium michaelis is often found in coastal areas and can be a hardy plant in garden settings.
